#Delirium: busted pilot; "Reef Madness"-esque vibe comes off as silly; leads never sell the central romance; never squares circle about cure
#OnceWonderland: for better/worse just doesn't feel any different from parent show; Lowe has charms; some inside baseball if new to the show
#Believe: vague mythology
column4: backstory gets frustrating; weird fight sequences; that said

text: #Reckless: awkwardly plotted
column4: executed; case of the week plays as afterthought; never quite gets a handle on what it wants to be; odd pickup

text: #Lucky7: relentlessly dreary for a show about having something extraordinary happen; very few likable characters; just didn't connect to it
#Ironside: just a solid
column4: well-made procedural; Underwood as usual is great; supporting cast is amusingly colorful; Ironside INO but so be it

text: #Resurrection: slow burn is an understatement; pinhole view of "big event" nice change of pace; doesn't seem in any rush to give answers
#TheGoldbergs: really wanted to like but just feels flat; "real life" nods only compound the disappointment; maybe will turn into something
#KillerWomen: Helfer is all sorts of great
column5: twisty opening case; supporting cast doesn't get to do much

text: Twitter apparently ate these so apologies for the repost...
#MindGames: Zahn can be a little too much at times; ends up essentially punting on its already tenuous concept; could do w/o closing twist
#BackintheGame: actually a lot of fun; the kids are fantastic; balances heart
column4: funny well; couldn't think of a better #TheMiddle companion

text: #Betrayal: plays kind of like PG-13 episode of #RedShoeDiaries; no legit reasons for why leads are unhappy
column4: come off as selfish as a result

text: #TrophyWife: Akerman seems game for anything; Tsai steals the show as adopted son; wish it was sharper
#SuperFunNight: literally the CBS version filmed as single-cam
column4: but with equally unfunny cutaways; genuinely confused why this is on the air

text: #Intelligence: so great to have Holloway back on TV; some genuinely cool
column4: fun moments; mythology a little muddy; unapologetically "CBS"

text: #Hostages: feels more thought out than similar fare; still plot holes aplenty; pilot is all setup but closing sizzle promises crazy to come
#TheCrazyOnes: not surprisingly Robin being Robin; Wolk actually a nice surprise here; closing blooper is fun; but show needs to be funnier
#Mom: actually better than you'd think; big
column4: brassy in the usual Lorre way; Faris
column5: Janney fun together; has real POV; may be something here

text: #TheMillers: you'll either love its fart and old people sex jokes or be out rather quickly; over-the-top Bridges
#WeAreMen: all the usual refrains: wish it was funnier
column4: more distinct; cold open straight from #HappyEndings pilot; cast gives me faith tho

text: #FriendswithBetterLives: your standard nuts-and-bolts friends sitcom; no standout performances
Time for a few more pilots...
@JWalkShrugs Thanks! Yes
column4: full thoughts to come on all of the above soon (including busted pilots). Just sharing some gut reactions.

text: Will have more written up this afternoon.

column5: bold; simply unlike anything you'll see on TV; all in good ways

column4: slick; sexual abuse stuff is unsettling; a lot of plot for just 1 hour of TV

text: #TomorrowPeople: like #Arrow
column5: slick out of the gate; well cast
column6: directed; easily one of this year's strongest pilots

text: #The100: wish it was grittier
column4: darker; speeds past interesting char development
column6: still filled with loads of potential

text: #StarCrossed: likable in spite of its endless navel gazing; sadly doesn't bother with any metaphors to situation; plenty of silly plot turns
#SleepyHollow: surprisingly entertaining despite being batshit crazy; you'll either drink the Kool-Aid or think it's the dumbest thing ever
#TheBlacklist: kind of bonkers in an entertaining way; Spader enjoyably chews the scenery; plot turns a little obvious; could be fun though

text: #SeanSavestheWorld: unabashedly sitcom-y

column5: char turns; Hayes does all the heavy lifting

text: #WelcometotheFamily: concept has potential; just wish it was funnier; O'Malley
column4: Chavira have a nice spark; their wives don't get much to do

text: #MichaelJFoxShow: Fox surprisingly game to poke fun at himself; supporting cast unexpectedly strong
column4: funny; genuine laugh out loud moments

@LauinLA Thanks

column4: ' says #AnnaTorv on playing 2 Olivias. 'I love it.' #Fringe #paleycenter

text: The guys say their goal is not to frustrate or betray the audience. Taking Peter out is a way to look at show (& chars) a different way.
Now that Peter doesn't exist
column4: how does that effect everyone? 'That's the right question to ask

text: 'I wish you could see yourself as I do' is a line from the show that #JohnNoble loved saying to #AnnaTorv. #Fringe #paleycenter
'We don't start a season until we know where we're going
column4: says @JWFRINGE on planning out the season. #Fringe @paleycenter

text: @JPFRINGE says by 2nd episode of SERIES they knew of Walter stealing young Peter and Olivia's doppleganger. They wrote towards those things
#AkivaGoldsman calls the internet a really big writer's room. (In other words
'We use it as a feedback loop to tell us if we're doing our job well
'The feedback is constant and immediate
column4: ' says @JPFRINGE on how social media is impacting their jobs creating #Fringe #paleycenter

text: 'I believe that all the cream rises to the top eventually
column4: ' says @JWFRINGE on the show not getting Emmy love...yet! #Fringe #paleycenter

'That's the biggest compliment
column4: ' says #AnnaTorv when fans realize she's not really American. #Fringe #paleycenter

text: RT @paleycenter: Jeff: That's one thing we embrace. Walter could be the ultimate villain
column4: but we got to know him as this gentle man. #Fringe

text: 'No one knows my real name
column4: ' says #JohnNoble on fans calling him Walter. #Fringe #paleycenter

text: 'Anytime that I ever get stopped...its only questions about the show...the show is the star
'What Walter did is what any father would do at that moment
'Choices are what life is all about

#KelliWilliams says her research playing a shrink is that she sees a shrink. 'I look for micro-expressions' during therapy.
Does anyone on the panel do research? Yes! #AngieHarmon hung out with Boston police to research for #RizzoliAndIsles.
The panel members each tell how they got their roles on their respective shows.
#MargHelgenberger once wanted to be a nurse like her mother but the acting bug bit.
#MaryMcCormack is off the hook because never heard that Brent Favre emailed her on Facebook to ask for a date.
#BorisKodjoe has said he could beat Serena Williams. 'I've never lost to her.' (He's never played her either)
#KelliWilliams got her SAG card at 6 months old for diapers! More nakedness!
Did a fan actually run #MattBomer off the road? TRUE! He was on foot on Sunset Blvd.
